task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 207°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full façade and roofline of the building ahead to estimate its height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointing north and upward, so I need to rotate back toward ~207° (southwest) while keeping an elevated pitch to capture the building’s roofline for height estimation.
To estimate height I need the roofline and as much of the building as possible in view, so I should tilt up while staying aimed at the southwest building.
The camera has snapped back to heading 0° again, so I must rotate left to re-align to ~207°SW while keeping the upward pitch for roof visibility.
I should give the final estimate now based on the apparent ~3-story building scale (roughly 3.5 m per story plus roof), totaling around 12 m.
